intro: Tiquilia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Tiquilia cuspidata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
